headline: United Steelworkers union frustrated by Starbucks’ closure of unionized Alder Crossing store in Surrey
summary: BURNABY, British Columbia, Sept. 25, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The United Steelworkers union (USW) is expressing frustration and shock following Starbucks’ decision today to close its unionized Alder Crossing store in Surrey, B.C., this coming weekend. The Alder Crossing location, situated in a busy retail corridor off King George Boulevard, has long been a thriving store. Starbucks has provided no clear explanation for why this location was selected for closure. The USW believes the decision rai

headline: Intel upgrade, Tesla, Starbucks $1B overhaul: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Allie Canal track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including the stock upgrade Intel (INTC) received by Seaport Research Partners as the chip foundry operator reportedly pursues an investment from Apple (AAPL), Tesla's (TSLA) sliding European sales, and Starbucks' (SBUX) $1 billion restructuring plan that includes store closures and job cuts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: CoreWeave expands OpenAI deal, Starbucks $1B plan, GDP revised
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks Thursday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Second quarter gross domestic product (GDP) was revised higher, showing its fastest growth in two years. Starbucks (SBUX) announced a $1 billion restructuring plan, which includes layoffs and store closures. CoreWeave (CRWV) has expanded its deal with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) by up to $6.5 billion. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Starbucks Announces Store Closings, Layoffs. It Still Hasn’t Figured Out Its Turnaround.
summary: Starbucks is closing hundreds of coffee shops and laying off 900 employees as part of a $1 billion restructuring effort.  Starbucks had 18,734 locations as of June 29.  “We identified coffeehouses where we’re unable to create the physical environment our customers and partners expect, or where we don’t see a path to financial performance,” CEO Brian Niccol wrote in an open letter.

headline: Starbucks Will Close 1% of Stores, Cut 900 Jobs
summary: Starbucks is trying to save more money. It's closing 1% of its stores in the US and Canada and it's cutting 900 jobs. Wall Street might have wanted to see deeper cuts for a company with 360,000 employees as of last year and 41,000 locations globally. Bloomberg's Shelly Banjo reports.

headline: Starbucks $1B restructuring reflects broad 'economic-wide issue'
summary: Starbucks (SBUX) has announced plans to cut 900 jobs and close 100 locations as part of its $100 billion restructuring plan. The news comes just months after the company laid off 1,100 employees in February. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma, Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré, and Northwestern Mutual Wealth Management Company chief investment officer Brent Schutte join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss the details. For more, check out Yahoo Finance's full interview with Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol from July. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Starbucks to Close Hundreds of Coffee Shops, Lay Off 900 Workers, CEO Says. Here’s Why.
summary: Starbucks  is closing hundreds of coffee shops in the U.S. and Canada and laying off 900 corporate employees as part of a $1 billion restructuring, the company announced Thursday.  Starbucks  had 18,734 locations as of June 29.  “We identified coffeehouses where we’re unable to create the physical environment our customers and partners expect, or where we don’t see a path to financial performance,” CEO Brian Niccol wrote in an open letter.

raw.headline: Starbucks to Close Hundreds of Coffee Shops, Lay Off 900 Workers, CEO Says. Here’s Why.
raw.summary: Starbucks  is closing hundreds of coffee shops in the U.S. and Canada and laying off 900 corporate employees as part of a $1 billion restructuring, the company announced Thursday.  Starbucks  had 18,734 locations as of June 29.  “We identified coffeehouses where we’re unable to create the physical environment our customers and partners expect, or where we don’t see a path to financial performance,” CEO Brian Niccol wrote in an open letter.

headline: Starbucks to cut 900 jobs, close some underperforming stores
summary: Starbucks said Thursday that it will eliminate 900 nonretail jobs and "close many open positions."The coffee retailer will also shutter some of its underperforming stores, CEO Brian Niccol told employees in a memo.

headline: US GDP, imports investigations, Starbucks overhaul: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are moving lower Thursday morning after US GDP (Gross Domestic Product) for the second quarter saw the US economy grow at its fastest pace in two years. The Trump administration is launching national security investigations into robotics, industrial machinery, and medical devices imports. Starbucks (SBUX) announces a $1 billion restructuring plan as part of CEO Brian Niccol's turnaround goals for the coffee chain. Also watch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol from July. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Starbucks to close hundreds of stores, lay off 900 workers as part of turnaround plan
summary: Starbucks said Thursday it's closing hundreds of U.S. and Canadian stores and laying off 900 nonretail employees as it focuses more of its resources on a turnaround.  The Seattle coffee giant said store closures would start immediately.  In a research note Thursday, TD Cowen analyst Andrew Charles estimated Starbucks will close around 500 stores in its fiscal fourth quarter.

raw.headline: Starbucks to close hundreds of stores, lay off 900 workers as part of turnaround plan

The Seattle coffee giant said store closures would start immediately.  In a research note Thursday, TD Cowen analyst Andrew Charles estimated Starbucks will close around 500 stores in its fiscal fourth quarter.
